quoteFirst: It offers courses common to all the specialized sections, such as psychology, French, pedagogy, civics, and school legislation, and includes five sections, fundamental to its organization: Physical education, manual arts, drawing and penmanship, domestic economy, and vocal music. title: Some phases of educational progress in Latin America
author: Montgomery, Walter A. (Walter Alexander), 1872-1949

title: With Haig on the Somme

quoteLast: , the trench occupied by my company was heavily bombarded. Shells and bombs have damaged our works very seriously for about 50 yards. Two shelters were entirely destroyed. quoteFirst: So a simple plan was long ago devised for the continual change of watches. The day was, indeed, divided into six watches of four hours each, but the last watch of each working day, viz. that from
quoteLast: , was subdivided into two "dog" watches of two hours each. Nearly all the pleasant memories of fo'c'sle life cluster around the second of these. From 4 to 6 p.m. (I speak of an ordinary British ship) the watch on deck round up the day's work, put things away, sweep up decks, etc.
title:
The Men of the Merchant Service
Being the polity of the mercantile marine for 'longshore readers
author: Bullen, Frank Thomas, 1857-1915

quoteFirst: Got under way again at 9.40 A.M. Laid to off Ambrose Light Vessel at 1.20 P.M. Joined Group No. 1 at 1.50 P.M. and took departure from Ambrose Light Vessel at 2.09 P.M., standard speed 12 knots. At 2.30 P.M. weather became misty again which necessitated closing in to keep the convoy in sight. The
quoteLast: watch had difficulty in keeping steam for 12 knots. Blowers were used to assist. Ship lost distance which was recovered in the next watch and position maintained.
title: The Corsair in the war zone
author: Paine, Ralph Delahaye, 1871-1925

quoteFirst: There is a sound on board ship which it is always pleasant to hear,--the bell tolling the hour of the "watches." The day is divided into three watches of four hours each. The last watch of from
quoteLast: is divided into two, and is called the dog watch; it prevents the necessity of one officer always coming on duty at the same hour every day.
title:
Forty Thousand Miles Over Land and Water
The Journal of a Tour Through the British Empire and America
author: Vincent, Ethel Gwendoline, 1861-

quoteFirst: “At day-light this morning we had the pleasure of seeing the enemy’s squadron as before mentioned, reinforced by eight gun boats, standing towards us in close line. The action began at
quoteLast: , exchanging broadsides when within pistol shot, passing along their line, and cutting off the cutter and gun boats. The enemy were under the necessity of wearing to renew their junction with them; but were prevented by the Spartan taking her station on their weather beam.
title: Memoir of the Life and Services of Vice-Admiral Sir Jahleel Brenton, Baronet, K.C.B.

quoteFirst: Mercury has a direct motion during the month of 51° 51′; and his diameter increases from 5″ to 6.8″. On the 1st, he rises at 4:56 a. m., and sets at
quoteLast: ; on the 16th, rises at 6:23 a. m., and sets at 8:31 p. m.; on the 30th, rises at 7:16 a. m., and sets at 8:22 p. m.
